p: All variables are numerical data presented as mean and standard deviation (SD). Normality test Shapiro–Wilk was used to examine whether or not the variables follow a normal distribution. All quantitative variables showed parametric distribution; therefore, One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used for comparison between the groups. Tukey’s post hoc test was used for pairwise comparison between the groups when ANOVA test is significant. The significance level was set at P ≤ 0.05. Statistical analysis was performed using Minitab 17.1.0 for Microsoft Windows.
